intro: Dichapetalum leucocarpum, commonly known as the white fruit tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is notable for its distinctive white, fleshy fruits that resemble small, inflated capsules. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
